Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory69.jpg'}
{3: "Unlike the artificial light of Babylonia's simulated weather, true sunlight on the surface always carries a warmth you can feel on your skin."}
{3: 'A gentle, autumn morning glow spills into the room. You stand at the sink, your mind still soft with sleep...'}
{2: '(Turn on the faucet and wash face)', 3: '6', 4: '(Wipe your face with a towel)', 5: '8'}
{3: 'The shock of water, chilled deep in the night, jolts the last haze from your veins.'}
{3: 'The rough cloth, soaked in fresh water, delivers a bracing chill that jolts the last haze from your veins.'}
{3: "Freshened up, you glance at the antique clock, a relic strikingly different from Babylonia's modern aesthetic, hanging above the bathroom mirror. It reads 8:00 AM."}
{3: "Just as you move to open your terminal and review last night's files, a notification chimes from your communication app."}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryTongxunHalfNew.prefab', 3: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: "Commandant, let me guess... you were working on Babylonia reports late again last night, weren't you?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Well...', 3: '19', 4: 'No way, definitely not me.', 5: '19', 6: 'You saw it wrong.', 7: '19'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "No excuses! I saw the emails you sent... that's why I made sure to let you sleep in a little this morning.", 4: '1'}

{2: 'Liv', 3: "I left some breakfast for you on the table. I'm just heading out to do some preliminary research for our mission. I'll be back before you know it, and I promise I won't leave the conservation area.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "So, take your time. You can review your work from last night... there's no need to rush out on my account.", 4: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxTongyong/FxUiGuanbixiaoshi.prefab', 2: '2', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryTongxunHalfNew.prefab', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxTongyong/FxUiGuanbixiaoshi.prefab', 4: '1'}
{3: 'The message ends here.'}
{2: '(Go eat breakfast)', 3: '32', 4: '(Review work on the terminal first)', 5: '32'}
{3: "After a quick review of last night's work on your terminal, you send the files back to Babylonia and turn to leave the room."}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory731.jpg'}
{3: "As promised in Liv's message, breakfast awaits on the table: the usual compressed rations and nutritional supplements. It's far from a gourmet meal, but it will fill the void."}
{1: '1004', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory544.jpg', 3: '0', 4: '1', 5: '1'}

{3: 'Beyond the window, the sun crests the dark mountain peaks, washing the land in a gold light. Below, soldiers patrol in orderly formations, while residents of the conservation area move in and out in neat lines, tools in hand—another day of gathering and production begins.'}
{1: '1004', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory544.jpg', 3: '1', 4: '0', 5: '1'}
{3: 'You turn from the view, down the nutritional drink in one go, and clamp a ration biscuit between your teeth. With both hands now free, your attention returns to the terminal interface.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryWhiteNew.prefab', 2: '2'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory1145.jpg'}
{3: 'Conservation Area 368, 07:23'}
{3: 'Mission: New Construct Frame Trial'}
{3: 'Personnel: 【kuroname】, Liv'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png'}
{1: '—  Some Time Earlier  —', 3: '70', 4: 'ffffffff', 6: '1'}
{3: '—Some Time Earlier—'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory263.png'}
{1: 'Babylonia'}
{3: 'Babylonia'}
{3: 'Some time has passed since your conversation with Ishmael.'}

{3: "She confessed that her own entanglement in events might have clouded her vision; she could no longer clearly observe the world's progression. Everything was now hurtling toward an unpredictable future."}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryWhiteNew.prefab', 2: '2'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory1116.jpg'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Ishmael', 3: 'I cannot offer you any more help. I am but a recorder, a soul anchored to the echoes of what has been.', 4: '1'}
{2: "I'm here to talk about what's happening now.", 3: '78'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: "I understand the question in your heart, Gray Raven. But a river's current cannot be judged before it reaches the sea. Its nature is only revealed in its entirety.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Is there anything else you can share?', 3: '80'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: 'I have walked many potential paths of this "future" in my thoughts... but I cannot share them with you.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: 'I cannot be certain my perceptions are true, or that we are even navigating the same stream of causality.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: 'If... and I mean if, our paths truly converge again, in a time yet to be, you may find the footprints I have left in the dust.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Her gentle smile was a quiet punctuation mark, drawing the conversation to a close.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryWhiteNew.prefab', 2: '2'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory17.jpg'}
{3: 'Still adrift in the echoes of your talk with Ishmael, you were almost surprised to find yourself already at the entrance of the Science Council.'}

{3: 'You cast another glance at your terminal. The mail from Hassen was marked urgent, but its contents were starkly simple: "Head to the Science Council immediately." You wonder what could warrant such a summons.'}
{2: '(Knock on the door)', 3: '94'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory232.png'}
{3: 'The Council was as it always was, a stark, white space filled with the hum of instrumentation and the dry, sterile air.'}
{3: 'Sitting at the table, Asimov gave you a nod and turned back to the projection displayed on its surface.'}
{1: '1', 3: "The projection displayed Liv's new frame. Along one edge, a cascade of data points and analytical text scrolled past, continuously materializing only to fade away."}
{3: 'Amid this torrent of shifting information, a single value held constant, its digits steadily climbing: 733.22.'}
{3: 'Before Asimov could utter a word, the door hissed open. Hassen strode inside, his entrance stirring the sterile air.'}
{3: 'His eyes swept the room in a quick, analytical glance before he moved with purpose to the long table.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Hassen', 3: "Sorry for the delay. Today's routine meeting overran its schedule. I hope I haven't missed the critical part.", 4: '1'}
{2: "Is this about Liv's new frame?", 3: '124'}
{3: 'Hassen settled into a chair at the long table, exchanging a silent nod with Asimov. In response, Asimov tapped a command into his terminal and turned away.'}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStoryFront/BgStoryFront43.png', 3: '0', 4: '1', 5: '0.5'}
{3: 'Beep. Click.'}
{3: "The door behind you sealed with a definitive thud. At the same moment, the small red lights on the room's surveillance cameras winked out."}
{3: 'Your instincts sparked, the unusual security measures sending a jolt of alarm through you.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Asimov', 3: 'I will be direct. The Science Council has recently recovered a cache of Golden Age data and materials. It pertains to a...', 4: '1'}

{3: 'As Asimov spoke, his fingers glided across the terminal. In response, the raw data and explanatory text were turned into structural diagrams and framework outlines, overlaying the frame projection.'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'It is a "new technology" capable of establishing a direct interface with the M.I.N.D.', 4: '1'}
{2: '...With the M.I.N.D.?', 3: '148', 4: 'Hmm... Can you elaborate?', 5: '148'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'The dataset enables numerous complex functions: structural optimization, amplitude stabilization, and a reduction in connection risks, among others.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "In simple terms, it can enhance the M.I.N.D.'s capabilities and unlock previously unattainable potentials.", 4: '1'}
{3: "Rows of data, highlighted in bright green, materialized beside the frame, corroborating Asimov's every word."}
{2: 'That... sounds like a good thing?', 3: '152'}
{3: 'Your fingers drummed a silent, restless rhythm on the table as you waited for the real truth.'}
{3: 'A mere technological breakthrough would have been announced at a formal briefing, not whispered to you in a secluded room with the surveillance deliberately disabled.'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "However, these optimizations are transient. The subject's M.I.N.D. will revert to its baseline state in as little as two or three hours, or at most, twenty-four.", 4: '1'}
{2: "So it's an emergency measure?", 3: '156'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "It's Golden Age technology.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Asimov stepped aside to make more room as the 2D display sequentially showcased various frame images.'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'President Hassen... do you comprehend the implications?', 4: '1'}

{2: 'Asimov', 3: "The Science Council's standard explanation for M.I.N.D. technology is just a generalist overview. It describes the basic function of a M.I.N.D. within a Construct, and little else.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'Regarding its deeper architecture... I am not authorized by the Science Council to discuss that. Or, to be more precise, the World Government has not authorized me.', 4: '1'}

{2: 'Asimov', 3: "In the current frame development, even with specialized models, we have rarely introduced additions to the M.I.N.D.'s core data structure. The IO-based interface system merely installs a security protocol on the periphery; it does not modify the M.I.N.D.'s fundamental composition.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'But this technology is different. It can optimize the M.I.N.D. structure itself, and that is merely a side effect. Its true purpose... is "to filter."', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: "I can't grant you that authority either, Asimov.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "We compared all the Construct data from Babylonia, and even accessed the Kurono database. Only Liv's M.I.N.D. demonstrates near-perfect compatibility with this dataset.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: 'What are you trying to do?', 4: '2'}

{2: 'Asimov', 3: "Professor Hippocrates of the Star of Life and I have collaborated on this. If we implement this dataset, there is a calculable probability that the migraine in Liv's M.I.N.D. could be permanently cured.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'In our calculations and simulations, we have not detected any adverse side effects. However, as we have not conducted physical tests, it remains an unknown variable.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Where did the data come from?', 3: '175', 4: "What happens if we don't use it?", 5: '175'}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: '...I think we should stop here.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'I can assure you this does not originate from any inhumane experimental procedures.', 4: '1'}

{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'This has nothing to do with Kurono, Project Winter, or any other projects with questionable origins, methods, or objectives. However, I cannot share more specific information with you right now.', 4: '1'}

{2: 'Asimov', 3: "I must remind you that simply replacing Liv's frame would provide a minor therapeutic effect for her M.I.N.D. migraine, but it would not result in a complete recovery. The condition would persist, like a chronic migraine.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'For a moment, the laboratory fell into a delicate silence.'}
{3: 'After a moment, Hassen spoke in a low voice.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Hassen', 3: "Gray Raven Commandant, I suspect you... have other questions you haven't voiced directly.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: "Like why I'm here.", 4: '1'}
{2: "A simple frame replacement surely wouldn't warrant a personal visit from the President.", 3: '188'}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: "So... Asimov, does this technology carry implications far beyond what you've disclosed?", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Hassen narrowed his eyes slightly, his question cutting through the air.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Asimov', 3: 'No. I am simply curious why you have remained silent on this particular issue for so many years.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Hassen', 3: 'If one day you were faced with only two choices—an honest extinction, or a hypocritical survival—what would you choose?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: 'Trillard already made that choice for us once.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: "I don't fear my own destruction. I only need to believe that everything we have fought for until now has meaning.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: 'But if the choice were yours to make...', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Asimov', 3: 'What if... Liv were the one forced to make that choice?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'You voiced the answer almost instinctively.'}
{2: 'But I cannot accept a choice like that.', 3: '206'}
{2: "I won't allow Liv to be placed in such a position.", 3: '207'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Hassen', 3: 'Relax, Commandant 【kuroname】. No one is going to force you or Liv to make such a choice.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: 'This meeting was simply to inform you of this data. As her commandant, you have the right to know, and you must be aware.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'So what is this new technology, really?', 3: '211'}
{3: 'Hassen offered no answer.'}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: "Let us consider this nothing more than a casual conversation. I have other matters to attend to, so I'll take my leave.", 4: '1'}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStoryFront/BgStoryFront43.png', 3: '1', 4: '0', 5: '0.5'}
{3: "Hassen avoided a direct reply, rising to his feet as the room's illumination returned to normal."}
{3: 'He was already working on his terminal as he walked toward the exit, pausing for a beat with his hand on the door before he opened it.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Hassen', 3: '【kuroname】... The choice has always been yours to make. We simply cannot provide any further information. I trust you will consider the matter carefully.', 4: '18'}
{3: 'He put on his customary smile, nodded to both you and Asimov, then strode out of the laboratory with purposeful steps.'}
{2: '...What does he know?', 3: '232', 4: 'This "choice"... is it connected to that dataset?', 5: '234'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Asimov', 3: 'I have no clue.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'He probably has his own agenda, but that is not my domain. My concern is strictly the observable effects this dataset produces when interfacing with M.I.N.D.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'The dataset is far more complex than it appears. Look here, and here... these wavelength patterns are anomalous.', 4: '1'}

{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'In a standard Construct, it would likely function as a new stabilizing framework. But if installed in a host with specific parameters... my hypothesis is that it would produce a different outcome.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'Similar to the specialized frames we previously enhanced using experimental data.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'For a compatible Construct... this could represent a new form of evolution.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'So, are you recommending we proceed with the implementation?', 3: '244'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'From a purely scientific standpoint, I would recommend Liv attempt the procedure. However, as the President stated, the choice is not ours to force upon you or her.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "If there are no further questions, I must return to verifying the dataset's integrity.", 4: '1'}
{3: "Asimov's voice faded, its place seamlessly taken by the soft hum of laboratory equipment powering up."}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory731.jpg'}
{3: 'Squeak—'}
{3: 'The door slides open with a whisper, its sound pulling you back to reality.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: 'Commandant? Why are you working in the middle of breakfast...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Just finishing up something urgent.', 3: '261', 4: 'Just looking around.', 5: '261'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'You really should take a proper break to eat. I know how it is during field operations, but skipping meals will only upset your stomach later.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Liv gives you a mildly disapproving look, her brow furrowed with gentle concern.'}
{2: 'Ahem... So, what did your investigation turn up?', 3: '265'}
{3: 'You shovel the last of the rations into your mouth and chase it with a gulp of nutrition fluid, your words garbled around the hurried meal.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: 'Well, I used a personnel survey as a pretext to access the resident list. That man, Kolm, is indeed registered here.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "Then, I cross-referenced the location names he mentioned during his questioning back in Babylonia... I think I've managed to narrow down our search to this area.", 4: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryWhiteNew.prefab', 2: '2'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStoryFront/BgStoryFront39.png', 4: '4'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory422.png'}
{3: 'Liv opens her terminal, her fingers circling a modest area on the map. The highlighted zone contains three tents, two buildings, and a crossroads.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: 'So, if Kolm was telling the truth...', 4: '18'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'The people who mentioned "evolution" and "M.I.N.D."... should be operating somewhere right here.', 4: '18'}
